title: Execute block is very slow

body:
"After I restart erigon" - you will execute blocks which was executed in the past (most of data is in ram - this is reason why it's faster. 
current bottleneck is "disk read latency" (not throughput). 
execution of blocks is single-threaded now (it will be changed in Erigon3) 


Because you have big RAM - you may try next command to force some data to RAM (not sure will it help or not):
```
make integration
./build/bin/integration warmup --bucket=PlainState --datadir=<datadir>
cat <datadir>snapshots/v1-013000-013500-* > /dev/null
```

> "After I restart erigon" - you will execute blocks which was executed in the past (most of data is in ram - this is reason why it's faster. current bottleneck is "disk read latency" (not throughput). execution of blocks is single-threaded now (it will be changed in Erigon3)
> 
> Because you have big RAM - you may try next command to force some data to RAM (not sure will it help or not):
> 
> ```
> make integration
> ./build/bin/integration warmup --bucket=PlainState --datadir=<datadir>
> cat <datadir>snapshots/v1-013000-013500-* > /dev/null
> ```

I got some improvment, now it's about 8 blk/s. But I wonder if I can skip block execution? 

And what's the milestone for erigon3? When it's available?

`if I can skip block execution?` - Erigon has no feature of "snap sync of latest state" yet. so, need exec now. 

`what's the milestone for erigon3? When it's available?` - we don't have ETA yet, because recently we extended scope. It's in development under `--experimental.history.v3` and not production-ready yet.  
See also: https://erigon.substack.com/p/big-release-and-renaming-of-erigon https://erigon.substack.com/p/future-of-the-support-of-bnb-smart https://erigon.substack.com/p/erigon-receives-200000-grant-from
The speed is still too slow for me, I think I'd better find some snapshot
Turn out the shame is on the ssd. After I changed it to WestDigit, the speed can go up to 25 blk/s
